title: 109_s702
content: Repeal of occupational taxes on distilled spirits, wine, and beer. The repeal of occupational taxes related to distilled spirits, wine, and beer under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the removal of various subparts and sections, such as those pertaining to proprietors, brewers, wholesale dealers, retail dealers, and general provisions. Additionally, a specific amendment is made to section 5131 regarding nonbeverage domestic drawback. The Code is amended by removing the provision for a special tax per annum and repealing the industrial use of distilled spirits. Additionally, there are conforming amendments to the heading and table of subparts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Code is amended by removing the provision for a special tax per annum and repealing the industrial use of distilled spirits. There are also conforming amendments to the heading and table of subparts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including miscellaneous provisions related to manufacturers of stills, nonbeverage domestic drawback claimants, recordkeeping, registration by dealers, and other provisions. The Code is amended to redesignate subparts and sections related to manufacturers of stills and nonbeverage domestic drawback claimants. The Code is amended to redesignate subparts and sections related to manufacturers of stills and nonbeverage domestic drawback claimants. Subparagraph (A) is amended by removing certain headings and subsections in Part II of subchapter A of chapter 51 of the Code. The Code is amended to move Section 5114 to Subpart C and rename it as "SEC. 5121. RECORDKEEPING BY WHOLESALE DEALERS." The Code is amended to move Section 5114 to Subpart C and rename it as "SEC. 5121. RECORDKEEPING BY WHOLESALE DEALERS." Additionally, subsections (c) and (d) define wholesale dealers in liquors and beer, as well as the term "dealer" in relation to the sale of distilled spirits, wines, or beer. The Code is further amended to include provisions regarding the sale of distilled spirits, wines, or beer in quantities of 20 gallons or more, which may indicate engagement in wholesale liquor or beer dealing. Additionally, Section 5124 is relocated to Subpart C of the Code. Section 5124 of the Code is amended by inserting a new heading after section 5121. "Section 5122 requires retail dealers to maintain records." Retail dealers are defined in subsection (c) as follows: a retail dealer in liquors sells distilled spirits, wines, or beer, a retail dealer in beer sells only beer, and a limited retail dealer has restrictions on their sales. The term 'limited retail dealer' refers to organizations or individuals selling alcohol at specific events, while a 'dealer' is defined in section 5121(c)(3). Section 5146 is moved to a new location in the tax code and redesignated as section 5123. Section 5146 is moved to a new location in the tax code and redesignated as section 5123. Every dealer subject to recordkeeping requirements must register with the Secretary, providing their name, residence, trade or business details, and business location. For provisions on dealer registration in distilled spirits, wines, and beer, refer to section 5124. Section 5131 addresses packaging distilled spirits for industrial uses, while section 5132 pertains to prohibited purchases by dealers. "Section 5132 prohibits dealers from purchasing distilled spirits for resale from anyone other than a wholesale dealer in liquors who keeps the required records. Limited retail dealers can buy from retail dealers. Penalties and forfeiture apply." For penalty and forfeiture provisions related to violations of subsection (a), refer to sections 5687 and 7302. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including section 5002, 5010, and 5052, defining terms and updating references. The term "brewer" refers to a person who brews or produces beer for sale, excluding those who only produce tax-exempt beer. Section 5182 of the Code is amended accordingly. Section 5112 requires recordkeeping by wholesale liquor dealers, while section 5122 requires it for retail liquor dealers. Section 5402(b) is amended to replace "section 5092" with "section 5052(d)". Section 5671 is amended to remove reference to "or 5091". Part V of subchapter J of chapter 51 is repealed, and sections 5142, 5143, and 5145 are moved to subchapter D of chapter 52. It includes changes to section numbers and the insertion of new language in certain sections. Amendments to the tax code regarding liquor and tobacco products include changes to section numbers and language in specific sections. Amendments to the tax code regarding liquor and tobacco products, including changes to section numbers and language, will take effect on July 1, 2005, but will not apply to taxes imposed before that date.
